text: I Love You Avenue is the third solo album by English singer-songwriter Nick Heyward. It was released in 1988 through Reprise Records and produced two UK singles, ‘’You’re My World’’ (#67 in the UK Singles Chart) and ‘’Tell Me Why’’. ==Recording and production== The album was produced by Heyward's manager, Graham Sacher, and recorded at four studios: Village Recorders in Dagenham, London; Rooster Studios, Mayfair and PRT. ==Track listing== == Personnel == Credits are adapted from the album's liner notes. * Nick Heyward – Composer, vocals, electric guitar, acoustic guitar, keyboards, design * Peter Beckett – Keyboards * Richard Bull – Guitar * Nick Coler – Keyboards * Les Nemes – Bass guitar, drum programming * Jackie Rawe – Backing vocals * Gary Sanctuary – Keyboards * Paul Spong – Trumpet * Phil Smith – Saxophone * Pete Thoms – Trombone * Andy Whitmore – Keyboards ;Production * Graham Sacher – Record producer * Richard Bull – Engineer * Ian Richardson – Assistant engineer * Nick Sykes – Assistant engineer * Arun Chkraverty – Mastering * John Hudson Mixing * Simon Halfon – Design, photography ==References== == External links == * * Category:1988 albums Category:Nick Heyward albums Category:Reprise Records albums
